Torchbox

Oxford Geek Nights #19

| 7:30pm

Keynotes

Keynote speakers are invited to talk at Oxford Geek Nights. OGN19 will feature:

  • Making things fast, by Leila Johnston, podcaster, newspaper editor, comedy writer and punk broadcaster (slides, video)
  • CMIS: encouraging connections, by David Caruana, Alfresco (slides, video)

Microslots

These are five-minute "lightning" talks that anyone can volunteer for. Want to volunteer for a microslot at OGN19? They're easy to do: pick something that excites you, or a project you've worked on that you think might be of interest; then talk to a friendly audience for just five minutes with a handful of slides. Submit your microslot and we'll see you on the night!

Currently confirmed microslots are:

  • Internet Plumbing for Beginners, by Ben Ward (slides, video)
  • Industrial Twitter Robot Slays Oxford Geeks; Total Carnage At Local Tech Event, by Matt Thorne (slides, video)
  • Mobile Ox and the Molly Project, by Tim Fernando (slides) (video)
  • J2EE vs Python for web development, by David North (slides, video)

Join the mailing list

Oxford Geek Night is a regular meet-up for designers & developers run by Torchbox

We have two keynote talks of 15 minutes each followed by a handful of 5 minute micro-slots.
